text: My work on designing reproducible and clinically translatable deep neural networks was posted to medRxiv.
Our work on assessing statistical methodology errors in Radiomics-ML research was published in Radiology together with an accompanying editorial.
I presented my work on improving clinical deployability of AI models at the Radiological Society of North America (RSNA) Annual Meeting 2022.
I co-authored a book chapter on opportunities and challenges of DL in brain lesions, published in the Lecture Notes in Computer Science book series.
I presented my work on test performance estimation of unlabelled data using conformal predictions at the International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML) 2022.
I presented my work on improving repeatability of AI models at the Medical Imaging with Deep Learning (MIDL) Conference 2022.

I was recently featured on a Voice of America Program and Report, a Dartmouth Press Release and on the corresponding Video Announcement pertaining to Dartmouth going need-blind for international student admissions in 2022.
Our review on AI applied to musculoskeletal oncology was published in Skeletal Radiology.
Our work on systemic coagulation activation in brain tumor patients was published in the Journal of Neuro-Oncology.
I was awarded the Derek Bok Certificate for Distinction and Excellence in Teaching for Spring 2021
I was selected as a Resident Tutor at Harvard College for 2021-beyond (multiple year full-year role)
I was selected as a Summer Proctor at Harvard College for Summer 2021-beyond (multiple year summer term role)
I received a 260 on the USMLE Step 1 ('first part of medical licensing') exam, placing me in the top 4% of all examinees
My work on language lateralization in resting state fMRI was accepted at the American Society of Neuroradiology (ASNR) 58th Annual Meeting 2020
I was profiled on the Dartmouth Medicine Magazine as part of its Student Spotlight for Spring 2020
I was awarded the Medical Student Research Fellowship at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (MSKCC) for Summer 2019
I was featured on The Dartmouth as part of a series on Demystifying the Dartmouth Grad Student Experience (print)
I was selected as an Urban Health Scholar for 2018-beyond
I was awarded the Tucker Center Chaplain's Award and selected as a Baccalaureate Speaker for Commencement 2018. (official photos from Dartmouth's Facebook and Flickr pages)
I was awarded high honors on my undergraduate thesis, and graduated Phi Beta Kappa, Tau Beta Pi, and Magna Cum Laude, with 4 citations for academic excellence (detailed on LinkedIn)
My work on radiotherapy-induced Cherenkov luminescence imaging in a body phantom was published in the Journal of Biomedical Optics
Our work on coagulation activtion in brain neoplasms was published in the Blood journal in relation to the 59th American Society of Hematology (ASH) Annual Meeting and Exposition 2017
